chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel Glen Reamer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel Glen Reamer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel Glen Reamer was found guilty of Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If the debt is not paid or payment arrangements have not been met, the Clerk of Courts office will refer the amount due to the WDOR for collection action.

with credit and good time.

Associated with Charge #2
Def from PCJ

08:35 AM Defendant Daniel Glen Reamer in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Defendant Daniel Glen Reamer in custody.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Walker: guilty to Ct#2; dismiss Ct#1. 9 months jail w/55 days credit and $518 court costs. Atty Loberg and Defendant agree. Defendant waives his right to personal appearance.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. def pleas guilty to Ct#2. Counsel stipulate to factual basis.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily and waives constitutional rights. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea. Court finds Defendant guilty of Ct#2 and dimisses Ct#1. ADA Walker addresses sentencing. Atty Loberg addresses sentencing. Court orders 8 month jail- consecutive to 21CF167 and 21CF266 w/55 days credit and good time. Court costs  ($518).   Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 9:03
signed by Defendant and Atty Loberg
from Judge Rohl to Atty Loberg's letter "approved. Please go through plea questionnaire in advance of the hearing"
from Atty Loberg requesting the STC be changed to a plea and for the Defendant to appear via zoom.
Status conference on June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
filed by Atty Loberg

records.addlTxt: Atty Loberg states a motion was filed to modify bond but he is currently on a PO Hold. ADA Walker objects to the bond modification. Court denies the request. Bond continues in its present form.
Pre-trial conference on June 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG. Court confirms address. Court adjourned at 4:10 pm.
Def from PCJ

4:03 PM Defendant Daniel Glen Reamer appears from Jail via video, Atty Jens Hubert Loberg, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Loberg states DE would like to waive the PH. Court questions DE. Court finds DE freely, intelligently and knowingly waives constitutional right to a PH.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 11:30 am.

4:08 PM Defendant Daniel Glen Reamer appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Schieffer is requesting a $1,000.00 CB w/conditions of AS, NTE OR NC w/T.M.W., Atty Nelson objects. Court orders a $500.00 CB w/conditions requested. DE does qualify for PD. Prelim demanded. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 4:19 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
